message.content:
cs.GT, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with dynamic mechanism design, which is a subfield of game theory (cs.GT). It also involves optimization and decision-making under uncertainty, which are topics in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of the Gittins algorithm, which is a well-known algorithm for solving multi-armed bandit problems, suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the subfield of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the paper involves information theory, as it seeks to balance exploration and exploitation in a way that takes incentives into account, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the subfield of information theory (cs.IT).
